text: Bill and Camille Cosby arrive at the Montgomery County Courthouse in Norristown, Pa., on April 24. ( Matt Slocum / AP ) Seven days after Bill Cosby was convicted on three counts of sexual assault, Camille O. Cosby offered a fiery defense of her husband, the iconic entertainer. Her nearly 800 - word statement, posted to Facebook Thursday morning, likened her husband ’ s ordeal to the racially charged killing of Emmett Till and called the accusations and ensuing conviction “ mob justice, not real justice. ” “ In the case of Bill Cosby, unproven accusations evolved into lynch mobs, ” she wrote.
